snippet: Ivory Coast’s press council has suspended all six newspapers allied with former President Laurent Gbagbo for up to two weeks for publishing content deemed “contrary to national reconciliation.”
abstract: Ivory Coast’s press council suspends all six newspapers allied with former president Laurent Gbagbo for up to two weeks for publishing photos of officials whom Gbagbo tried to name to his cabinet after he lost the November 2010 elections.
lead_paragraph: Ivory Coast’s press council has suspended all six newspapers allied with former President Laurent Gbagbo for up to two weeks for publishing content deemed “contrary to national reconciliation.”
